description: The Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Nord Kivu imposed a 14-day confinement on the eastern city of Goma, effective May 20, 2020. The provisions of which include a police-enforced mandatory curfew from 8:00 pm to 5:00 am. The police have limited movement within city limits by setting up roadblocks as well as by detaining or imposing fines [20,000 to 200,000 Congolese francs ($11 to $110)] on those found in violation of the new curfew.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On December 18, 2020, the government of the Democratic Republic of the Congo imposed a nationwide curfew from 9pm to 5am. No end date has been announced. During curfew, only the movement of persons with special authorization from the provincial authority, with the exception of persons in a health emergency, will be permitted.
On 24 March 2020, the President of the Democratic Republic of the Congo declared a 30-day long State of Emergency to control the spread of COVID-19.
The Democratic Republic of the Congo has declared a national state of heath emergency on March 24th.

Only aircraft and cargo ships and other means of freight transport will be allowed access to the national territory and their personnel subject to controls

description: Democratic Republic of the Congo implements health checks at the airports for all passengers starting on March 10. Those who show symptoms will be moved to government facilities for further testing, and those who test positive for Covid-19 will be hospitalized at government expense.

With the March 24 State of Emergency, the President of the Democratic Republic of the Congo instructed the government "to find ways to supply the crowded cities, where there is an almost permanent lack of water and electricity, to ensure hygiene; to increase the number of hand washing points in the country's airports and to support the teams of the Airways Authority (RVA) and the General Directorate of Migration (DGM) so that no one escapes the hygiene control."

target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: DRC bans travel between Kinshasa and all other regions in the country.

With the March 24 State of Emergency, the President of the Democratic Republic of Congo also imposed a 30-day long ban on all travel to and from capital of Kinshasa  in order to allow the confinement of Kinshasa, the source of the pandemic.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: On March 23, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Haut-Katanga imposed a 2-day confinement on the entire region. The measure was taken after two people who arrived on a Congo Airways plane tested postive for coronavirus arrived to the city of Lubumbashi. This 48-hour confinement was announced in order to trace the other travelers aboard this flight and was enforced by the military and police.

On 28 March, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa imposed a 3-week confinement on the entire region. The population will be authorized to go out two days per week to purchase food and other basic necessities. Only administrative staff providing minimum services as well as healthcare personnel will be allowed to circulate.
link: NA ; https://www.bbc.com/afrique/region-52057717 ; BBC News | Afrique ; La capitale congolaise sera sous confinement total dès ce samedi ; https://afrique.lalibre.be/48352/rd-congo-confinement-intermittent-a-kinshasa/ ; https://pulitzercenter.org/reporting/controversial-communication-around-covid-19-drc ; https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/327256/drc-authorities-postpone-lockdown-on-kinshasa-march-27-update-5

description: On March 26, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa announced a 3-week confinement on the entire region. The population will be authorized to go out two days per week to purchase food and other basic necessities. Only administrative staff providing minimum services as well as healthcare personnel will be allowed to circulate.

On 6 April, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Nord Kivu imposed a 14-day confinement on the cities of Goma, Beni, and Butembo Only vehicles without passengers transporting food and basic necessities are allowed to circulate.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On April 6, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa imposed a 14-day confinement on the eastern city of Gombe. The measures are enforced by the provincial police with threat of fines and/or imprisonment. Gombe is considered the political, diplomatic and economic hub of the DRC as well as its "epidemic epicenter". Healthcare personnel, journalists and employees of banks and telecommunications services will be allowed to circulate freely while a maximum of 10 persons per company are authorized to enter Gombe.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
On 11 March, 2020, the governemnt of the Democratic Republic of the Congo launched its COVID-19 preparedness and response plan which established a multisectoral response committee for COVID-19 (CMR-COVID-19). CMR-COVID-19 is chaired by the Prime Minister, while the Minister of Health acts as Secretary. It provides the government's policy direction, mobilizes resources and manages funds. 

"The COVID-19 is comprised primarily of the following departments: Interior, Security and Customary Affairs; Health; Finance; Budget; Communication and Media; Transport and Communication Channels; Fisheries and Livestock; Planning; Social Affairs; Humanitarian Actions and National Solidarity; Higher and University Education (ESU); Scientific Research and Technological Innovation; Defense, National and Veterans Affairs; Justice and Attorney General; Primary, Secondary and Technical Education; Environment and Sustainable Development; International Cooperation, Regional Integration and Francophonie; Foreign Affairs."
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: The Democratic Republic of the Congo is enforcing a 14-day self-quarantine on passengers having traveled to China, France, Germany, Italy, Iran, South Korea, and Iraq in the 14 days prior to their arrival into the country but who show no symptoms at their time of arrival. Passengers who transited in the countries but did not leave the airport are subject to no restrictions.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: All travelers entering the DRC who have a fever will be tested, and any persons positive for COVID-19 will be hospitalized at DRC government expense. Both categories will be subject to a mandatory 14-day quarantine.  All persons traveling domestically from Kinshasa to other provinces will be subject to preventative screening.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description:
Democratic Republic of Congo
July 22
As of July 22, shops, banks, restaurants, bars, and public transport were reopened. Schools, universities, and places of worship were also allowed to reopen. 
Changes impact the public.

description: On April 20, the governor of Kinshasa announces the mandatory wearing of a protective mask in public places. Barrier mesaures will be reinforced by the police and army in the rest of the communes of the city of Kinshasa to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.
